content.prompt: According to the passage, which of the following is an implication for executive-legislative relations in Mexico following the 2012 elections?

choices.label: Mr. Peña will have to work with members of his party as well as the opposition to get legislation passed.
Once the PAN party chooses a new leader, that person will serve as Mr. Peña’s vice president.
Since the Mexican legislative and executive branches are fused, Mr. Peña will have a relatively easy time passing legislation.
The PRI will quickly pass new legislation, which Mr. Peña will sign into law before the opposition party chooses a new leader.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Explain how the implications of the author's argument or perspective may affect political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
